com.zookitec.layout
Class Expression

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.zookitec.layout.Expression
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Expression
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class represents a constant expression and is the superclass of all variable expressions used by ExplicitLayout. Subclasses should override the computeValue method to provide a variable value for the expression.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Summary
static byte ROUND_CEILING
          Rounding mode to round the value of this expression towards positive infinity.
static byte ROUND_FLOOR
          Rounding mode to round the value of this expression towards negative infinity.
static byte ROUND_NEAREST
          Rounding mode to round the value of this expression towards the nearest integer neighbour unless both neighbours are equidistant, in which case round up.
static byte ROUND_NONE
          Rounding mode to assert that no rounding is performed on the value of this expression.

Field Detail

ROUND_NONE

public static final byte ROUND_NONE
Rounding mode to assert that no rounding is performed on the value of this expression.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ROUND_NEAREST

public static final byte ROUND_NEAREST
Rounding mode to round the value of this expression towards the nearest integer neighbour unless both neighbours are equidistant, in which case round up.

See Also:

Rounding mode to round the value of this expression towards positive infinity.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Expression

protected Expression()
Constructs an invalid expression. This constructor is intended for use by subclasses. The default rounding mode is ROUND_NONE.

Expression

public Expression(double value)
Constructs a constant expression. This can be used when the value of a variable is known at design time.

Parameters:
value - the value of the expression.
Method Detail

getValue

public double getValue(ExplicitLayout layout)
Gets the value of this expression. If the value is not already known, it is set by calling computeValue. The value may be rounded to an integer depending on the rounding mode.

Parameters:
layout - the ExplicitLayout manager
Returns:
the value of this expression

setRoundingMode

public void setRoundingMode(byte roundingMode)
Sets the rounding mode for the value returned by getValue.

Parameters:
roundingMode - the rounding mode: ROUND_NONE, ROUND_NEAREST, ROUND_FLOOR, ROUND_CEILING.

getRoundingMode

public byte getRoundingMode()
Gets the rounding mode for the value of this expression.

Returns:
the rounding mode: ROUND_NONE, ROUND_NEAREST, ROUND_FLOOR, ROUND_CEILING.

invalidate

public void invalidate()
Forces the value of this expression to be recalculated by calling computeValue next time getValue is called. This only applies to subclasses as the value of this expression is constant.

computeValue

protected double computeValue(ExplicitLayout layout)
Computes the value of this expression. This implementation returns the default value 0. For variable expressions, this is typically overridden by a subclass.

Parameters:
layout - the ExplicitLayout manager
Returns:
the value of this expression
